latest.title: Release of Updated Corporate Presentation
latest.content:
9 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 7186K
URU Metals Limited
09 December 2025
09 December 2025
URU Metals Limited
("URU" or the "Company")
Zeb Nickel Project
Release of Updated Corporate Presentation
URU Metals Limited ("URU" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that a new corporate presentation for the Zeb Nickel Project is now available on the Company's website at:
https://urumetals.com/
and viewable via the link:
http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/7186K_1-2025-12-8.pdf
Corporate Presentation Highlights:
• Confirmation of a magmatic conduit system linking the Uitloop intrusions.
• Identification of seven high-priority drill targets supported by coincident gravity-magnetic-electromagnetic anomalies.
• A refined geological model and updated cross-section defining the Project's stacked mineralised zones and extended potential.
• Recognition of untested nickel-rich horizons that were not intersected in historical drilling.
• Strengthened evidence for Platreef-style Ni-Cu-PGE mineralisation within Zone 2.
The updated presentation provides enhanced detail on the Project following the integration of the final airborne geophysical results (gravity, magnetic and Spectrem electromagnetics), together with an updated geological model and revised schematic cross-section. These updates collectively improve the understanding of the Project's nickel sulphide potential and significantly refine the technical foundation for the next phase of exploration.
The data highlights a magmatic conduit system linking the Uitloop ultramafic bodies and defines multiple high-priority drill targets, several of which are supported by coincident gravity-magnetic-electromagnetic anomalies and remain untested. The presentation also outlines the Project's exploration strategy, geological interpretation updates, and the upcoming work programme designed to unlock further resource potential.
CEO John Zorbas commented:
"
We are very pleased to release this updated presentation, which consolidates two years of geological and geophysical work into a comprehensive technical package. The integration of the airborne gravity, magnetic, and EM data materially enhances our understanding of the Zeb Nickel Project and highlights several compelling sulphide targets that have never been drill tested. These results position the Company to advance into the next phase of exploration with greatly increased confidence.
"
URU Metals Limited
John Zorbas
(Chief Executive Officer)
+1 416 504 3978
SP Angel Corporate Finance LLP
(Nominated Adviser and Broker)
Ewan Leggat / Jen Clarke
+ 44 (0) 203 470 0470

latest.title: Extension of Convertible Loan Maturity Date
latest.content:
2 Dec 2025 18:11
RNS Number : 9644J
URU Metals Limited
02 December 2025
2 December 2025
URU Metals Limited
("URU" or "the Company")
Extension of Convertible Loan Maturity Date
URU announces that the repayment date for the convertible loan from Boothbay Absolute Return Strategies LP ("
Boothbay
") has been extended to 31 March 2026 ("
Maturity Date
") and Boothbay has also agreed that it will not convert sums due under the convertible loan note into ordinary shares of the Company ("
Ordinary Shares
") prior to 31 March 2026.
Details regarding the convertible loan note were announced by the Company on 6 May 2020, and the maturity date for the note has been extended on a number of occasions since this date by agreement of the parties. As of today, the total amount advanced by Boothbay Absolute Return Strategies LP to the Company was US$500,000.
Unless repaid by the Company, amounts due to Boothbay under the convertible loan note shall convert at or prior to the Maturity Date:
(i) at a price that is a 35 per cent. discount to the Volume Weighted Average Price ("
VWAP
") per share in the 5 trading days prior to the noteholder serving a conversion notice;
(ii) on completion of an equity fundraising by the Company, at a price that is a 35 per cent. discount to the price per share paid by investors on such equity fundraising;
(iii) on a share sale (meaning a sale of Ordinary Shares giving control of the Company, whether for cash and/or by way of exchange for shares in another company and/or for other consideration, and whether or not control of the Company changes as a result of such transaction), a 35 per cent. discount to the price per share paid on such a share sale; or
(iv) if there is no conversion notice served, equity fundraising or share sale prior to the Maturity Date, at a 35 percent. discount to the VWAP per share in the 5 trading days prior to the maturity date.
In the event that Boothbay is issued with any new Ordinary Shares pursuant to a conversion of the loan note, it will be issued with one warrant attaching to each new Ordinary Share issued, with an exercise period of 18 months from the date of grant and exercisable at £0.85 per new Ordinary Share.
Market Abuse Regulation (MAR) Disclosure
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Article 7 of the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) 596/2014 as it forms part of UK domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 ("MAR"), and is disclosed in accordance with the Company's obligations under Article 17 of MAR.
For further information, please contact:
URU Metals Limited
John Zorbas
(Chief Executive Officer)
+1 416 504 3978
SP Angel Corporate Finance LLP
(Nominated Adviser and Broker)
Ewan Leggat / Jen Clarke
+ 44 (0) 203 470 0470
